results.description:
This month's special guest presenter:

Terry Monaghan

Productivity Expert & CEO of Time Triage™

"Avoiding a Million Dollar Mistake"

Did you know that 89% of business people surveyed acknowledge that they are frittering away nearly half of their day? (Many don’t call it ‘frittering away’ - they are just crazy busy!) This disengagement is actually costing each of them over $1 million in income over the course of their lifetime. What’s more, it has been estimated that it is costing businesses over $759 BILLION a year. To put that in perspective, that’s $50 billion MORE than the budget for DOD in 2011…

What do you think could be possible if you reclaimed even some of that lost time?

Let’s discuss!


With over 30 years of business and entrepreneurial experience, Terry's unique technology has dramatically increased the productivity of Fortune 100 executives and entrepreneurs in a variety of industries. Whether it's a corporate executive or a "solo-preneur," the outcome of Terry's methodology will give you an expanded level of freedom and productivity with results you can measure.

Terry's clients find themselves working on what is most fulfilling and what really matters in moving things forward rather than what they previously thought they "had to do." The things you hoped to get to someday become the things you work on today. Terry’s work was recently featured in the New York Times best-seller Overwhelmed: Work, Love, and Play When No One Has The Time by Brigid Schulte.

Every month, The Baltimore/Washington PowerTeam features a special guest speaker delivering content on a variety of topics of interest to high performers like you. Health and fitness, nutrition, finances, relationships, careers, overall mental well-being – we cover it all. Plus our outstanding peer group offers the support, encouragement – and accountability – to help you stay on course toward the life you want to lead. Make plans to join us at our next meeting and help spread the word to others who would benefit from the value we provide!


• Meeting dates are usually the 2nd Wednesday of each month -- or as announced when conflicts arise. (See below)


• Please RSVP to me at '[masked]' if you can make it or contact me at[masked] if you have any questions or concerns.


• Guests are always welcome and we'd appreciate a donation of $5 or $10 to help build our charitable budget. In past years, your generosity has helped us feed more than 2,000 local residents at-risk during our Basket Brigade annual food drives. In addition, we've also fed and cared for a number of local homeless people through our Backpacks For The Homeless initiative. Thanks to your help, we'll do even more this year!


Rest assured, we strive to give PowerTeam members an outstanding return on their investment of time and effort at every meeting. That means more social and volunteer activities. More personally relevant content. More skill and mastermind sessions. More goal setting. More support and accountability. If you know of a great presenter you'd like to recommend for an upcoming meeting, please let me know – we're always open to new guests who provide value.

Mark your calendars for these upcoming 2016 meeting dates:
June 8 • July 13 • August 10 • September 14 • October 12 • November 9

No December meeting due to Date With Destiny.
Holiday party plans to be announced.


We hope to see you all at a meeting or event soon. Have an outstanding day and live with passion!


Dave

Do you want to invest in real estate but you just don’t know how to get started?


Or have you already done some real estate deals and you want to move to the next level? Are you looking to surround yourself with other investors who are learning how to become successful and build long term wealth without spending a fortune?

Then this class is for you; the beginner as well as the experienced investor, MAREIA member or not-yet members are all welcome.

MAREIA (Mid-Atlantic Real Estate Investors Association) was established to assist anyone who wants to find out more about real estate investing. Being a MAREIA member gives you so many benefits that we can’t explain them all during our regular meetings.

Starting with a good foundation is imperative to building a strong business. In this FREE 2 ½ hour Real Estate Investor Orientation Class you will get some practical advice about the steps that you need to take in order to get off to a strong start as a real estate investor.

Even if you’re an experienced investor, it always helps to get a fresh perspective on the foundations of running a successful real estate business.

Mary Jo Whelan will be your guide to all the money-saving products and services that you get when you join MAREIA. You will learn important tools that will get you started and keep you going as your real estate career takes off.

She will show you how to sign up and take advantage of the many money saving benefits like the Home Depot rebate and Pro program below. If you are already someone who shops at Home Depot we can help you save money as you shop.

Remember this is a FREE meeting which will show you how to get the full value of your MAREIA membership.


And if you’re not a member, you will see what you’re missing!

REGISTER HERE FOR FREE

From Amazon.com: A collection of original travel stories told by some of the world's best novelists, including Isabel Allende, Peter Matthiessen, Alexander McCall Smith, Joyce Carol Oates, Tea Obreht and DBC Pierre.


Exhilaratingly varied in place, plot, and voice, these tales all share one common characteristic: They manifest a passion for the precious gifts that travel confers, from its unexpected but inevitably enriching lessons about other peoples and places to the truths - sometimes uncomfortable but always enlarging - it reveals about ourselves.

"...a brilliant collection of travel stories...threaded with great warmth, as readers are invited to travel in the company of these famous authors and experience their passions and revelations." BOOKSELLER + PUBLISHER

Many copies of Better Than Fiction are available through the AA County Public Library.

As the summer approaches, we'll expand our Meetups to include cultural events, festivals and basically anywhere there is food. Suggestions are very welcome!

As always: Contributions toward the $15/month cost of hosting a Meetup are welcome. A few bucks go a long way.

results.description:
Hankerin' to draw some stuff? Then let's play Pictionary! Draw things to try to make your friends guess words. If you've never played before, the game goes something like this, according to Wikipedia:

The team chooses one person to begin drawing; this position rotates with each word. The drawer chooses a card out of a deck of special Pictionary cards and tries to draw pictures which suggest the word printed on the card. The pictures cannot contain any numbers or letters, nor can the drawer use verbal clues about the subject he/she is drawing. The teammates try to guess the word the drawing is intended to represent.

Please remember you must be 18 or older to play.


Don't forget your $1 for meetup.com costs. Our group usually sits in the back corner, close to where you pick up your food.

results.description:
What: This is an open ongoing mindfulness meditation group for both beginners and experienced practitioners.

While the forms of meditation we practice are rooted in Buddhist teachings, the study and practice of mindfulness and insight meditation is applicable to anyone from any background or religion, and all are welcome.

These teachings are available to all. Although a $10 donation is suggested, donations are not required for attendance.


Each class will include: guided meditation, instruction, opportunities to practice, and time for discussion, questions and answers.

When and where: We meet every Wednesday from 7:30-9:00 p.m. at Centennial High School, 4300 Centennial Lane, Ellicott City, MD, 21042, room 406. Please arrive early to settle into your seats - we start right at 7:30 p.m. [Note: Class will be canceled on days that the school is closed.]

We practice Insight Meditation, a style of meditation that helps the mind attain deeper levels of calm concentration through sustained attention on the breath, then combines this with the crucial aspect of insight through contemplation of the mind and body and all of their changing and impermanent senses, emotions and thoughts. Insight Meditation trains us to live more fully in the present moment, enables us to experience life from a greater stillness, and aids us in relating to both ourselves and others with increased clarity, compassion, calmness and creativity, and less fear, anxiety and stress.

Along with these and a long list of other psychological benefits, meditation has also been shown to reduce stress hormones in the body, lower blood pressure, reduce anxiety, alleviate depression and boost the immune system.

Teacher:

Stan Eisenstein, a high school physics teacher who has been meditating for 25 years and has been practicing Insight Meditation since 2004. Stan is a mentor with the Insight Meditation Community of Washington (IMCW) and is a graduate of the Meditation Teacher Training Institute, a two-year certification program with senior Insight teachers Tara Brach, Jonathan Foust, Hugh Byrne, and Pat Coffey. He also teaches Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) and Mindfulness Based Cognitive Therapy (MBCT). Stan also earned a Masters of Social Work in 1998.

Centennial High School Parking (see map below) - September through June:

If coming to the school from the South (Route 108) side of Centennial Lane, make a left into the bus loop just as you reach the school. Immediately on your left is a drive to a parking lot on the south/left side of the school. Park in this lot and follow the signs to room 406.

If coming to the school from the North (Route 40) side of Centennial Lane, make a right into the bus loop just as you finish passing the school. Immediately on your left is a drive to a parking lot on the south/left side of the school. Park in this lot and follow the signs to room 406.

Suggestions:

1. There are plenty of chairs, but if you prefer to sit on the floor, which is carpeted, please bring a hard pillow or zafu, since, when meditating, it is recommended that your hips be higher than your knees. If you have never tried sitting on the floor during meditation, it is highly recommended that you try the chair first, then practice sitting on the floor at home until you are comfortable.

2. If you have any back issues, please bring a pillow or cushion to place behind you.

3. The chairs are hard, so you may wish to bring a cushion with you to sit on.

4. Please remember to turn off your cell phones before entering the room.

5. Please try not to wear any perfume to the sit, as it can be quite distracting to others. Also, with respect to those who may be allergic, we do not use incense.

6. The group is not recommended for those under age 13.

Please feel free to contact Stan Eisenstein at [masked] if you have any questions.

results.name: Insight Meditation Class

The Athletic Director has told us that we MUST lower the backboards at the end of the evening. We need volunteers to make sure that this is done.


Our permit is until 11 PM, so we need to be out of the gym by then, with our equipment put away. If a game is almost over, it is OK to to finish the game, but it is NOT OK to start a new game around 11PM. Yes, for years, even though our permit was until 10:30 PM, we sometimes played until 11, 11:30 and sometimes even past midnight. Until-a new, nasty custodian turned us in to the Vice Principal, who sent an e-mail to the Rec council who forwarded it to us. We then had to be out of the gym 10:30 PM sharp, NO EXCEPTIONS. After that, when we put in for a new permit, we requested that the time be extended until 11Pm, which was approved.

results.description:
Thursday at 1:00 will be 66 degrees, & partly SUNNY!  Yay :)  6 mph wind with only 5% chance of rain.


Please look carefully at the instructions and map below to find out where to park and meet for the walk!

Lake Kittamaqundi, the downtown heart of Columbia. For many years, the path only went only part-way around the lake. But in the fall of 2014, the Columbia Association completed the circuit and we can now walk around the entire lake along a new paved path!

This walk is very flat, only one gentle hill, and 1.5 miles around. We'll pass by the People Tree, the lakefront stage, and long-established Columbia restaurants like Clyde's and Tomato Palace.


You will basically head for the new Whole Foods of Columbia (added in Fall 2014), across from the Columbia Mall. However, we will park and meet in the lower lot, down the hill, and to the right of Whole Foods (as you look at it from the front.) This is actually the parking lot for the new Haven on the Lake spa. Please park in the area furthest from the spa entrance, as shown on the map below, so that we are closest to the trail and won't get in the way of the spa clients.


SAFETY & COURTESY

Please arrive early, to allow the dogs time to sniff and form their pack. We will leave on time.  If you can't make it please change your RSVP promptly, or leave a comment.  We'll turn to the right on the trail (counter clockwise) so you'll know where to find us if you arrive late.  


Please bring water for yourself & your dogs.  We're trying to avoid sharing water on the trail to prevent the chance of spreading the New Dog Flu.


If you see joggers or bikers, please shout "ON YOUR LEFT" to keep the dogs safe from being trampled, and to protect others from tripping on our animals.

PLEASE READ:

Columbia Dogs on the Go provides a way for friendly people with friendly dogs to meet people with similar interests on a voluntary basis. By replying "Yes" to this RSVP and attending this event, you acknowledge that: 

•  You are responsible for your own safety and the safety of your dogs and any guests. 

•  Your dogs are current on their vaccinations.

•  Your dogs will be kept on a 6-foot fixed leash (non-retractable) and under your control at the Meetup.

•  You will clean up after your dogs at the Meetup.

•  You will update your RSVP if your plans change.

•  You understand that the Meetup ends when the walk ends. (If you choose to meet other members at a restaurant, dog park, or other location, it is on your own time and not part of the Meetup event.)

 Looking forward to seeing everyone again!  


                                                                       Photos by J. Ameen-Lee
results.how_to_find_us: See directions & map below.  Park  closest to the woods in the shade by the trail; we will meet there.
results.name: Thursday 1:00 p.m. Lake Kittamaqundi Walk

results.description:
When it comes to eLearning, voiceover audio almost always enhances the learner experience... except when the audio is of poor quality.

The good news is that you don't have to be a professional voiceover talent or use expensive hardware and software to create effective voiceover audio. In this free, live, webinar, Jeff Harris, SkillQ eLearning CEO and veteran multimedia producer, shares his insights on the tools and techniques needed to create quality audio for eLearning.

In this session Jeff will discuss: 

•  Creating a temporary audio recording studio in an office or even a closet 

•  The best microphones for voice-over production 

•  Recording devices and audio mixers

•  Audio editing tools for desktop and mobile devices

Jeff will present live from the SkillQ streaming studio and field audience questions and comments.
results.name: eLearning Audio Essentials with Jeff Harris

results.description:
A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 1-5.

Tragedy has struck, and the Society’s attention must turn from academics to action as they infiltrate a seemingly impenetrable facility in the heart of Ostenso, one of Cheliax’s greatest ports. They must act quickly, for only the distraction of a national holiday can provide the PCs the cover they need to get in, get the job done, and get out without drawing the attention of an entire city’s guards.

“The Infernal Inheritance” is the final scenario in the three-part Faithless and Forgotten campaign arc. It is preceded by Pathfinder Society Scenario #7–14: “Let Bygones Be” and Pathfinder Society Scenarios #7–16: “Lost Colony of Taldor.” All three chapters are intended to be played in order.

Content in “The Infernal Inheritance” also contributes directly to the ongoing storylines of the Dark Archive and Liberty's Edge factions.

You don't have to own a boat to join … you just have to get a thrill from feeling the wind on your face… or delight in meeting new friends.  Come along, learn and talk about our sailing schedule, where you can sail for less than a good meal ...

results.description: Susan teaches several types of meditation and brings new ideas to each session. Every week Susan offers a talk on how meditation can benefit you and how to incorporate practices into your daily life. Then we meditate in silence for 30 minutes. Don't be intimidated! Susan offers techniques to help you work with your thoughts, body tension, stress, etc. She also guides the group into the meditation and teaches pranayama (breath-work) to help us settle into the practice. Most people report a huge sense of calm, a sense of ease and an effortlessness in the practice. Question and answer time is also available. Susan is always open to new ideas, thoughts and suggestions.  $10 donation requested.

4. Sharing after the experience

results.description:
Drinking Skeptically is an informal social event designed to promote fellowship and networking among skeptics, critical-thinkers, and like-minded individuals. Drinking Skeptically provides an opportunity for skeptics to talk, share ideas (and yes, drink) in a casual, relaxed atmosphere. We discuss the issues of the day and whatever else is on our minds. But most of all, we have fun while promoting skepticism, science, and rationality. Don't drink? Don't let that stop you from joining us! Some of the world's most famous skeptics are teetotallers, and we are happy to have you! Remember that drinking skeptically means drinking responsibly. If there's one thing science has taught us, it's the effects of alcohol on the human body. To learn more about Drinking Skeptically see www.drinkingskeptically.org

The area set aside be the establishment for our group is not wheelchair accessible. The venue has no age restriction for the duration of our event.

CFI-DC encourages people with disabilities to participate in its programs and activities. If you anticipate needing accommodations or have questions about physical access you may email sdavis [at] centerforinquiry [dot] net in advance of the event.
results.name: CFI–DC Drinking Skeptically Baltimore Meetup

As Evelyn Leonard is no longer hosting this meetup- this meet up now has

TWO Co-hosts JOEL  (2nd THURS. )  & KEVIN (4th THURS) of each month

I am trying a new format for this meetup:

This format for the 2nd Thursday ONLY:

Each session should be divided into two groups. Each signer determines where they fit:

1st group: Fingerspelling & Flashcard and ASL books - in one group  (beginning/novice signers)

2nd group: Intermediate-Advanced/conversational (no talking, sign only)

THANKS,

JOEL and KEVIN

results.description:
Claude Monet was an avid horticulturist and arguably the most important painter of gardens in the history of art, but he was not alone. Great artists like Van Gogh, Bonnard, Sorolla, Sargent, Pissarro and Matisse all saw the garden as a powerful subject for their art. These great artists, along with many other famous names, feature in an innovative and extensive exhibition from The Royal Academy of Arts, London:

"A ravishing joy from start to finish." The Guardian *****

"Time and space dissolve in pure shimmering light and colour." The Telegraph ****

"A show that feels as intellectually invigorating as it is visually delightful." The Times ****

From the exhibition walls to the wonder and beauty of artists’ gardens like Argenteuil, Giverny and Seebüll, the film takes a magical and widely travelled journey to discover how different contemporaries of Monet built and cultivated modern gardens to explore expressive motifs, abstract colour, decorative design and utopian ideas.

Guided by passionate curators, artists and garden enthusiasts, this remarkable collection of Impressionists, Post-Impressionists, and avant-garde artists of the early twentieth century will reveal the rise of the modern garden in popular culture and the public’s enduring fascination with gardens today. Long considered spaces for expressing colour, light and atmosphere, the garden has occupied the creative minds of some of the worlds greatest artists. As Monet said, ‘Apart from painting and gardening, I’m no good at anything’. For lovers of art or lovers of gardens, this is an ideal film.

Watch a preview here.
results.name: Art Film: Monet to Matisse - Painting the Modern Garden

results.description:
LESS MATH, MORE WRATH!

--------------------


To be accepted to this game, please send a paypal of $5 to: [masked]

I will then hand you a $5 bill when you show up at the table.

--------------------

Step through the portal into a labyrinthine dungeon filled with mystical chambers, ravenous monsters, and nefarious tricks sprawled endlessly across crumpled sheets of graph paper. The Tower of Gygax is a classic dungeon crawl as envisioned by E. Gary Gygax. It is a game of wonder and danger whose currency is imagination and improvisation!

The Tower of Gygax is an eleven-story spiraling behemoth, its rooms and inhabitants drawn from the many worlds of D&D. In each session, the dungeoneers must make their way through one of the lairs occupying a level of the Tower; solving puzzles, battling monsters, and avoiding traps in an effort to escape with treasure and trophies in hand. The way through the Tower is uncertain and perilous.

Foolish or unlucky dungeoneers will meet a quick demise.

Guarding the exit of each floor is a dreaded Dungeon Lord - a fearsome villain whose defeat heralds a fountain of unholy might that can be used by the dungeoneers to increase their own power, Highlander-style. The final, eleventh floor contains the lair of the most dreaded Dungeon Lord and gatekeeper of the Tower - the demilich Acererack!

The Tower of Gygax takes pride in its fast, fierce, deadly, and entertaining gameplay. Since its inception at GenCon, the Tower has earned a reputation as being a terrifying, must-attend event. Now, Dungeon Master Ross has brought forth this gem of gaming goodness right to your front door!

Players can expect all materials, including PreGen character sheets, to be provided. Players who are new or inexperienced with the game rules are heartily welcomed.


Timid players with cautious or apathetic playstyles need not apply.

results.description:
This week's topic will be presented by Justin Linksz and is about boundaries. Boundaries are invisible fences around ourselves that protect what we let in and what we give out. Boundaries in essence say “I belong to me” and “you belong to you.” They establish a system of what is acceptable and what is not acceptable in our lives and in the lives of those around us.  Rather than merely separate, boundaries PROTECT what we possess and value, including our own life and body. By design, boundaries set the course for mutual respect, consideration, protection and safety in all forms of relationships.

Having clear boundaries is essential to a healthy, balanced lifestyle. In relationships of all kinds we need to know what our boundaries are.  Be it romantic relationships, friendships or acquaintances.  In this session we will learn about different types of boundaries and how to establish our own boundaries by developing our own "personal bill of rights". 

Orientation Meeting begins at 7:00 PM for new members

Regular Meeting begins at 7:30 PM

Then there will be small-group break-out sessions.
results.name: Single Again - Crofton

group.name: Changing Focus - Single Again in Crofton

results.description:
Join us for our next Toastmasters meeting on May 12. 

Ken, our Toastmaster of the Evening for the next meeting, has chosen "Pieces of the Puzzle" to be the theme, with the concept that, "It take a Village to Raise a Child." Each of us is a piece of the ever-evolving puzzle that is our community. ("Community" can be your neighborhood, nation, planet... you decide.) Please put aside the notions of modesty, boasting, and ego to briefly inspire us by sharing which "pieces" you have brought, or will bring, to the puzzle that is our world. 

Typically, Patuxent Toastmasters Club meets on the 2nd and 4th Thursdays of every month. Regular meetings start promptly at 7:30 PM at the historic Oliver's Carriage House in downtown Columbia, so come early and get to know us.


Here are a few snippets from our last meeting on April 28. Focus was on graduation. Kelsey, giving her third speech, graduated to the next level, and unfortunately out of our Patuxent Toastmaster lives. We wish her well! 

Oliver's Carriage house is located at 5410 Leaf Treader Way, Columbia, MD.

MAP

All are welcome.  Our club offers a diverse learning environment.  We have members from many different walks of life, ethnicities, religions and nationalities.  Although we meet in a community church, our club has no religious affiliations.
results.how_to_find_us: Historic Oliver's Carriage house is located at 5410 Leaf Treader Way, Columbia, MD.
results.name: Patuxent Toastmasters leadership & communication skills meeting

results.description:
This webinar will look at the difference between empathy and sympathy; help you understand empathy in the context ofEmotional Intelligence; and suggest ways to deepen empathy. 

Please note: This webinar will not send an email confirmation, make sure to add this event to your calendar, and log in to Webinara, to start the webinar on time.

To Attend This Webinar You Must RegisterHERE 

Why attend this webinar:

1. Learn about the differences between sympathy and empathy.

2. More in depth knowledge of empathy will help strengthen current relationships, and forge new ones.

3. Tips to enable empathy to become a more natural part of your personality.

More information about the speakers:

Q. Learning Ltd -Richard Carr - Managing Director

Richard is guided by a belief in the vital importance in giving people and organisations an opportunity to learn, develop and grow. This belief, and his desire to do the right things in the right way with the right people, are principles that run through every aspect of Richard’s personal and professional life.

Recording available 

Slides/PDF available

Information about the Organizer:

Q. Learning is a management consultancy specialising in: - Transformation and change management - Leadership and management development - Team, group and organisational collaboration We have developed diagnostic and assessment tools around 360 degree leadership, partnership working, personal development and board effectiveness. We are also an approved ILM Centre and an MHS EQi registered training centre and distributor.

To Attend This Webinar You Must Register HERE 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

P.S. We'd love your support and help in answering just a few questions if you are a current or former smoker...

We are building an IoT app that uses deep AI, Machine Learning and Gamification to help smokers quit!

The survey takes just a couple of minutes and by participating you will have the opportunity to win 1 of 500 KwitCase T-shirts. 

The survey is HERE.

On behalf of the Kwitcase Team,

Thank you :)

Jeff Robinson and Anna Morera Leralta

A postcard blitz to mainstream media, The Democratic National Committee, and Hillary R, Clinton in support of Bernie Sanders. We want it to be known that Bernie is the best candidate and should be selected for the Democratic ticket for the 2016 Election. This is "Bernie or Bust" at its finest.

Date: Friday May 13, 2016

Needed: 7 post cards, USPS approved size and 7 First Class Stamps.

What to do: Hand write: “Bernie or Bust” in message area of all 7 post cards. Hand address each post card to one of the addresses below. Put First Class stamp on postcard and mail the morning of May 13, 2016, so that the post date and mail date are the same.

DO NOT PUT Return address on postcard. NO Photocopies, postcards must appear as originals. They must not appear as advertisements, to be thrown out when delivered.

This method of support will be unexpected and unprepared for. Emails are invisible; postcards have bulk and are extremely visual. If enough are sent: Thousands, (Millions?) they can't help but be noticed and acknowledged.
Show the mainstream media, the press, the DNC, and HRC that we mean business when we say, “Bernie or Bust”.

Remember: Make Friday May 13, 2016 the day that will be remembered by those that try and suppress Bernie and our movement. We will not be ignored, only to be asked to support HRC. Let her know we are “Bernie or Bust” for the Democratic nomination for Presidential candidate.

results.description:
Join along with the BRMC to ride down to Wilmington, NC to visit one of the best touring Battleships afloat. The USS North Carolina BB-55 walking tour takes about 2 hours and just about everything is open from the Babetts to the Barbetts, explore where the Powder Monkey's dwelled, See and Feel the Monkey S@!t at Work, and see Charlie Nobel at his finest. Enjoy the 5"/30Cal's and the 16"/45Cal main turrets. Plenty of 20mm's abound as well. Trip starts Friday afternoon (Time to be Determined) with a ride down to overnight in Charlettsville Va, then ride from there Saturday morning to Wilmington, NC to tour the battleship in the late afternoon. Ride back home Sunday morning. Cost to tour the battleship is $14 and more information can be seen at http://www.battleshipnc.com/Visit/HoursTicketing.
Hotel reservations are to be made by each participant. Contact Ben Bark for further information and for hotel information
results.name: Weekend Ride to USS North Carolina Battleship-BRMC MEMBERS and INVITED GUESTS

results.description:
Join us for a camping weekend at Assateague State Park! We will be camping both Friday and Saturday nights. Plan on sunrises, Assateague ponies, beach and shore scenes, sunsets, and moonrises. Some evening hanging out at the camp fire as well! As this is a camping event, in order to get into the camp grounds you will need to reserve a campsite. This will give you and your vehicle access. To reserve a site, click here:
http://www.reserveamerica.com/facilityDetails.do?contractCode=MD&parkId=380507

There will not be a ton of structure to this Meetup. We will meet for Friday and Saturday sunsets and depending on how late the campfire goes, Saturday and Sunday sunrise. Mostly this will be about hanging out, capturing images, and sharing the experience. More information about times to meet and shoot will be forthcoming as we get closer to the event. 

The park requires you to reserve for 2 night minimums and spaces are limited, so if you are interested, you will need to act fast. Any of the sections will give you access to all the areas and are walkable. You will need camping gear (tent, long tent stakes for the sand, sleeping bag or bedding, air mattress or mat, towels, cooking gear or stuff for cold sandwiches, etc). You can buy firewood at a shop near by the camp ground. You cannot bring firewood with you. Make sure you see the rules for camping on the Reserve America website. Here are some images from our last trip.

results.description:
Do you enjoy free food?  Two-for-one drinks?  Bars on the water with hammocks strung between palm trees?  Me too, but sadly Hightopps has none of these things, it does though have great music with a huge deck you can enjoy the Spring weather on!

It's not a special occasion, it's not a celebration, it's just an excuse to have a happy hour and relax after a long work week. Come relax on the deck, or inside, at Hightopps and enjoy their dollar drafts and free entertainment.  For those who have never been they have a large deck bar, as well as an inside bar and dining area.  They are located next to the Maryland State Fairgrounds with plenty of free parking.   For those who do not get out of work until later we will be staying late so please feel free to still come down and hang out with us. This is also rated one of Baltimore's top 25 bars, just one more reason to come.....

 They have a huge outside, and inside area, live music, dollar drafts till 7:00, and $11 32oz. Island Punch Pitchers. 

http://www.hightoppsbackstagegrille.com/

Doug
results.name: Happy Hour at Hightopps for the hell of it

results.description:
***CLASS IS FULL***

**For full info and to register visit: charmcityfarms.org **


In this tribute to Artemisia vulgaris, so often named “the dream plant,” learn the nearly endless number of uses and traditions which have been associated with this alluring and beloved plant, which in this region grows wild in abundance. Whether for tea, smudge stick, dream satchel, moxa, culinary herb, beer and wine, or a smooth drag, out in the meadow you’ll learn how to harvest this plant and to craft it for yourself into some of its many diverse applications. Participants should each bring a cloth bag or basket and knife or scissors, and will go home with smudge sticks, a dream satchel, loose herb to dry, and whatever other crafts we get into.

This workshop takes place entirely outdoors, so please dress for the weather. If you prefer not to sit on the ground you are welcome to bring a pillow or lightweight folding chair.

**This workshop is limited to 10 participants.

Cost: $25


Instructor: Victoria Greba


**For full info and to register visit: charmcityfarms.org **


***CLASS IS FULL***
results.name: Mugwort: Craft, Medicine, Food, Smoke Workshop *FULL*

results.description:
Don't miss this Meetup! We want to clear up a few things! Misunderstanding about protein and carbs have undermined the progress of countless confused Americans.

Our team includes a medical doctor, a registered dietitian, and a couple of experienced health coaches who are ready to set the record straight! 

Once again, your loyal organizers have scoured You Tube for the best short videos on these critical but misunderstood topics. We discovered that Garth Davis M.D. is one of the best communicators about protein we’ve seen. He’s the author of the acclaimed new book ‘Protein-aholic,’ and a bariatric surgeon trying to put himself out of business. He is incredulous that the medical community, bariatric specialists included, seem to be ignorant of the basic published nutrition science.

And we’ve picked out the best short videos on the ridiculously popular topic of carbohydrates. Some swear they do better after going gluten-free (i.e. low carb). Yet some of the best published outcomes have been with diets that get 60 – 80% of calories from carbohydrates. 

Then there’s the potato controversy. People think they're “fattening.” But some respected authorities say that we’ve been avoiding these low-calorie comfort foods for too long! One of Chef AJ’s Secrets of Ultimate Weight Loss is: “Eat Potatoes.” 

How to explain the discrepancy? Hint: 90% of the carbohydrates Americans consume are . . . . PROCESSED. Bread flour is different than wheat berries, and corn flakes may not be quite the same as whole corn. 

Your four organizers, Joe, Vlad, Emily and Jamila, will be on hand to help and advise you during and after this meeting. Vlad and Jamila are experienced and inspiring coaches. Joe is an M.D. and Emily is an R.D. (Registered Dietitian). We're not looking for paying clients. In fact, Joe and Emily don't accept paying clients. We just want to help, as volunteers. 

Please bring a dish that is vegan (no dairy, egg, fish or meat of any kind), and not too much, if any, SOS (salt, oil, sugar). It's not mandatory to bring food, but please try to bring something to share that fits these criteria, so that we don't run short. You can get some ideas at <a>www.NutritionAsMedicine.org.</a>

If no time to cook, you can just bring some fruit, etc. If you're not in a position to bring food for any reason, that's OK, just bring yourself (and friends). 

And if you're new to all of this, you're especially welcome. 

If you are bringing a dish, PLEASE bring a piece of paper with your name, the name of the dish AND INGREDIENTS (or recipe, even better, but at least ingredients - for those who are food-sensitive or following certain diets). Your name, and name of the dish, is so people can ask you for the recipe. 

We raffle off great kitchen items each time. The raffle is open to anyone who is attending their first, second or third Meetup here, OR anyone who has brought food with a list of ingredients, or the recipe. 

If anyone has questions or wants to chat, please call Joe Adams M.D. at[masked] if you're not sure this is right for you, or if you're looking for a little help on how to break out of whatever barriers you might be facing. 

Please join the free, twice-monthly conference calls for extra support and information, with some of the organizers and other participants. They’re always on the Third Thursday and First Tuesday of each month, at 7:30 pm.  The dial-in number is always:[masked], and the access code is always[masked]#. These calls are listed as ‘Upcoming Meetups’ - Please RSVP (if you can) in the Upcoming Meetups section: http://www.meetup.com/Baltimore-Nutrition-As-Medicine-Potluck/?scroll=true


There’s a buddy system where we can put you in touch with one another, and also one-on-one support provided by the volunteer organizers. 

Enjoy this exciting journey, share your challenges or successes with others, and discover new foods often.

We can't wait to see you there! - Joe, Vlad, Emily and Jamila, the Nutrition As Medicine team.
results.name: Should I Eat Protein, Carbs, or Real Food?

results.description:
Description from KTA: "Old Loggers Path is an orange-blazed long-distance backpacking trail that follows former railroad grades, logging roads, bark trails, and other remnants of old industrial transportation, hence the name. The trail is a circuit through remote areas in northeastern Lycoming County. Highlights of the trail are the many revealing cuts on the railroad grades; Rock Run, one of the prettiest streams in Pennsylvania; and vistas over McIntyre Wild Area, Pleasant Stream, and the Loyalsock Trail region."

Detailed info on trail:

http://www.dcnr.state.pa.us/forestry/recreation/hiking/stateforesttrails/oldloggerspath/ - has a decent map including other nearby trails

D. Gantz, "Old Loggers Path Guide" available from pahikes.com at http://www.pahikes.com/trails/old-loggers-path is a reference guide.

Here's a description from the last running of it which I'm basically re-running: http://www.meetup.com/DC-UL-Backpacking/events/226664768/

The plan:

Friday:

7pm meet at Greenbelt metro for the folks from DC. While this is on the late side, I figure it's as early as we can do without hitting back traffic if anyone is driving from NOVA. Unless I hear otherwise, I'll drop down there to pick up the DC carless crowd. Use the comments section if you want other carpool options.  If this is causing you to drive completely around the beltway, use the comments sections to arrange a better carpool location for you.


Drive to the trailhead:
https://www.google.com/maps/dir/Greenbelt+Metro+Parking+Lot,+Greenbelt+Metro+Drive,+Greenbelt,+MD/41.5260118,-76.8317914/@40.2748897,-78.0054159,8z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m9!4m8!1m5!1m1!1s0x89b7c3ed7c050a69:0x30d998ecba736505!2m2!1d-76.9063764!2d39.0125285!1m0!3e0?hl=en
This has us heading up 95. If we have folks coming from downtown Baltimore, we could probably stop by the park and ride where I-70 ends right after 695 for car pooling. (Use the comments area if this applies to you)

We'll shoot for the same approach to the OLP as the last running. Specifically, parking near where the trail intersects Ellenton Ridge Rd. If Ellenton Ridge Rd turns out to be impassable with the cars that we have, the PA Bureau of Forestry map shows a trailhead off of the paved road NW of Ellenton onto the Hawkeye Cross Country Ski Trail, which connects to the OLP via the Sharp Shinned Trail.

We'll head clockwise around the OLP. Since it will be almost midnight when we hit the trailhead, we'll take the first reasonable dispersed camping that we come upon. Sunrise: 5:50am
Sunset: 8:20pm

Saturday: we'll shoot for between 20-23 mi. PA state forests have campfire bans until May 25th, so we'll probably catch up on the sleep that we missed on Friday night on Saturday night. The Mid-Atlantic map notes some nice campsites near Yellow Dog Road. We'll regroup at least twice on Saturday: at Masten and at the Pleasant Stream ford. Gantz's guide notes that the crossing at Pleasant Stream can be dangerious in high water, so we'll do some re-routing if it doesn't look safe to cross.

Sunday: remaining 6-8 miles. Likely stop at bullfrogbrewery on the way back for lunch. (opens at 9am). 229 West Fourth Street, Williamsport PA 17701

Round trip driving distance is around 460 miles, so expect to chip in $45 to your driver if getting a ride.

When you sign up, please message or email me at [masked] with your cell phone number and emergency contact info.


By RSVPing to this trip or any other DC UL trip, you agree to DC UL's liability waiver. http://www.meetup.com/DC-UL-Backpacking/pages/Liability_Waiver/
results.how_to_find_us: Black Toyota Corolla

This lecture will explore Pluto’s impact through transits and how the ‘soul’s intention’ is brought to consciousness in a variety of ways. Using the myth of Persephone, Pluto and Demeter we will explore the Tantra of Spirit, Soul and Ego (the Water Triad) and how they work in harmony and in discord, affecting our growth and experiences in life. Dynamics from: synchronicity, the dark night of the soul and how we react to losses will be discussed, in the light of understanding that Plutonian passages, no matter how harsh, ultimately do conspire for our evolution.

Private regression sessions will be possible on Sunday.  Please contact Patricia to discuss cost and times available:

 Who We Are

Pay at the Door (cash or check) OR

Pay online at  http://www.baltimoreastrology.org/baspaypal.php

About Patricia:

Patricia is a certified Deep Memory Process (DMP)®  regression practitioner (since 2002) and is the Chief US Trainer for Dr. Roger Woolger’s institute of Deep Memory Process.  She worked personally with Dr. Woolger, leading and co-teaching trainings in both Ancestral spirit work and Regression since 2003. She is also a graduate of the Jeffrey Wolf Green School of Evolutionary Astrology (2004) and is a certified Evolutionary Astrologer.

She is the author of  ‘Understanding Karmic Complexes : Evolutionary Astrology and Regression Therapy’  (The Wessex Astrologer, 2009).  She is also a contributing author to ‘ Insights Into Evolutionary Astrology : A Diverse Collections of Essays by Prominent Astrologers”  ( Llewellyn, 2010)

Frequently seen hanging around podiums as a lecturer and keynote speaker at NORWAC, UAC, ISAR, SOTA, various NCGR chapters and Astrological societies,  Balkan Astrology Conference (Serbia), Edmonton Astrology Conference (CAN), Romania, Vancouver, London and Australia.

Combined with astrology, she specializes in multi-dimensional healing work based in Shamanic principles including; Soul Retrieval/Fragmentation and Spirit Releasement (Ancestral and Earthbound Spirit work). Her focus is in healing present and past life trauma synthesizing both intuitive hands-on healing and therapeutic approaches.

Private sessions also available in Sarasota FL. Check my workshop schedule, I travel regularly, if I'm in an area near you, I may be able to schedule sessions.

The training program in Professional Past Life Regression is ongoing please see my Calendar. [masked]

Website: http://www.healthepast.com/

Every woman gets a padlock. Every man gets a key. Your goal is to match the right key with the right padlock. And more!

Lot fees average $6-$8 for the night starting at 5pm. Some lots are unattended and require you to put cash in their lot box. Neighborhood street parking is also available and is generally free after 6pm, though be advised to pay close attention to all parking signs.

Pick-up soccer games to be held at Soccer Stop from 8:00pm - 10:00pm for $10.00 per person.  Teams will be divided upon arrival. Each game will last 10-15 minutes and will be played in a round robin format.Must be present before 8:10pm.

Games will begin on the Large Turf (T1) and overflow onto the Small Turf (T2) if available.  Maximum 4 teams of 10 players on Large Turf and maximum 4 teams of 7 on Small Turf

Please call Soccer Stop,[masked], to reserve your spot. Soccer Stop will reserve up to 20 spots.  Once the 20 spots are reserved, the remaining spots will be filled on a first come, first serve, walk-in/drop-in basis. 

If you reserve a spot, but are not present for the first game starting promptly at 8:00pm, the reservation will be released and the spot will be filled by a walk-in player.  Please arrive early to check in and be ready to start on time. 

Players must be 21 years and older.  No cleats are allowed on fields/courts.

results.description:
Tango. Sunset. Incredible views of Annapolis Harbor and the Chesapeake Bay beyond. Live Music every Milonga and a wonderful, large linoleum floor to protect your dancing shoes! Join us for this magical milonga at Annapolis City Dock at the Annapolis Harbor.

There is limited reserved parking near the venue in addition to "unreserved" and a parking garage one block away off Main Street. Bring a folding chair for your own use. Come early or stay after to enjoy Annapolis restaurants, bars and shopping. After dancing, have some ice cream or fudge ... or drop by one the the many restaurants for a late night snack.

The milonga is sponsored by Art In Public Places, an agency in Anne Arundel county.

Please check on the weather reports and our Facebook group for any change in time at noted here - or cancellation.

Milonga is Free. An Intro to Tango lesson will be given before each milonga.
results.name: City Dock Milonga

results.description:
Gifted pianist in both jazz and classical music, David Kane’s style is cerebral, harmonic, technical, and stunningly beautiful.

His style can be similar to Bill Evans one minute and Oscar Peterson the next. He’s performed with Woody Shaw, Dizzy Gillespie, Nancy Wilson, Charlie Byrd, Dave Liebman and Branford Marsalis. He’s also performed with the Baltimore Symphony Orchestra, the National Symphony Orchestra, Kathleen Battle, Denyce Graves, Charlotte Church and Joshua Bell. Dave is also a regular pianist for the long running Capitol Steps. He can literally do it all! http://www.davidkanemusic.com/Home.html.

Doors open at 7:30 pm. Show starts at 8 pm. $20 for museum members/$25 for non members. Cash bar. Advanced ticket purchase is recommended. Purchase tickets on the Sandy Spring Museum website at www.sandyspringmuseum.org Seating is limited. Advanced ticket purchase is recommended.
results.name: Jazz in the Round – David Kane

results.description:
When you RSVP call[masked] and let them know you are with my party and they will take your payment.  With the discount it will be $68, tell them you with "Doug Hanford's" trip, or give them invoice number "P26192" Sadly they changed the start time for the Cheat River this year, so instead we will do the Lower Yough in the spring when the waters are a little higher then in the summer.  We are going to do the 10:30 start time!


 This is a guided trip through class II,III, and IV rapids, with lunch provided at the halfway point on the river.  This is a great trip for newbies and experienced rafters alike.  You do NOT have to be a strong swimmer, or a swimmer at all, to go on this trip.  Overnight camping is located is also located within Ohiopyle.!

pay here online use this promo code "PEFE" and pay by 4/30, and you will receive 15% off the cost of the rafting trips offered by Laurel Highland Rafting Tours in Ohiopyle !

This is a rain, or shine, event.  We will be meeting at a Park and Ride on I-70 for those looking to carpool, more information will be provided.  This event will fill up, so don't wait till the week before to register. 


 I recommend people bring the following:

- cash for dinner/driver/photo of trip/ t-shirts

- shorts, t-shirt, tennis shoes

- NO FLIP FLOPS are allowed

- Change of clothes for the ride home

- sunscreen

More info on the river

~ Doug
results.name: Whitewater Rafting on the Lower Yough (this trip will fill up)

results.description:
The Maryland Food Bank needs an accurate estimate of how many people will be volunteering for this event, so please update your RSVP as soon as possible if you aren't able to make it to this event.

=======================================


IMPORTANT VOLUNTEER INFO:

Open-toe shoes are PROHIBITED at the warehouse.  Wear clothes that you don't mind getting dirty (which probably won't happen, but it's a possibility).

Please arrive to the warehouse ON TIME.  We can't begin until EVERYONE is at the warehouse.

Additional volunteer info can be found at the MD Food Bank's website, at www.mdfoodbank.org.


=======================================

The Maryland Food Bank was founded in 1979 to coordinate the procurement and distribution of food donations from manufacturers, wholesalers, retailers and government agencies to organizations providing free food to the state's hungry.

Volunteers usually work on a high-tech conveyor belt in the warehouse, pulling specific types of food from the belt as they pass, and packing the sorted food into 25 - 50-pound boxes. Full boxes are then placed on the Maryland Food Bank's daily menu, available for more than 600 soup kitchens, pantries and shelters across the state to order.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet in the volunteer meeting area, which is on the left side of the lobby.
results.name: Maryland Food Bank

results.description:
Opened in 1839 as the city's first urban-rural cemetery, Green Mount is the final resting place of Johns Hopkins, Mary Elizabeth Garrett, Enoch Pratt, William and Henry Walters, Betsy Patterson Bonaparte, Arunch Abell, Moses Sheppard, Isaac Emerson, Albert Ritchie, Theodore McKeldin, Robert Oliver, Harriett Lane Johnston, William Henry Rinehart, John H. B. Latrobe, A. Aubrey Bodine, Walter Lord, John Wilkes Booth, and many more. The cemetery tour requires 2 hours of walking on varying terrain and is not friendly to those requiring assistance when walking.

This event will sell out and is sold on a first come, first serve basis so I would suggest that you forward your check (made payable to Wayne Schaumburg) or cash in the amount of $15.00 to Wayne Schaumburg, 3910 Klausmier Road, Baltimore, Maryland 21236 ([masked]) with your name, address, email and cell phone. Also check out http://www.waynesguidetobaltimore.com. I have already made by reservation. Meet inside the cemetery gate at Greenmount Avenue and East Oliver Street (parking inside the cemetery).

In this 60-minute interactive session, participants develop insight on how to reduce negative emotions - anger, regret, sadness, anxiety and fear - that eat up our energy and time putting an unnecessary burden on our efforts. This workshop is also an introduction to the Art of Living Course.

During the workshop participants will experience:


• Breathing techniques that increase energy and vitality


• A guided meditation


• The connection between our breath, emotions, mind, body & the Self

Participants will be introduced to tools to chart a new course to healthier, happier, stress-free living.

results.description:
Come out and play!!  Enjoy the beach; get some sand between your toes (and maybe in your ears if you like to dive.)

Baltimore Beach Volleyball would love for you to come check out one of Baltimore's hidden gems, seven courts of beach volleyball with water views! Most Saturdays, and Sundays, you can come brush up on your volleyball skills, learn some new ones, and make some new friends along the way playing coed doubles, fours, and sixes volleyball.  Baltimore Beach welcomes all skill levels, so don't worry if it has been a few years since you have bumped, set, spiked a volleyball.

None of your friends play volleyball, but you want to play?  No problem!  If you don't have enough people to make a team you can just join in with other teams, and people, already there.

If you find that you like the feel of sand between your toes while getting some exercise and making new friends, and want to play during the week, you can also join a Baltimore Beach Volleyball league.  Leagues play every night of the week,  more information can be found at: Information on Baltimore Beach Leagues 

Cost for all day "Drop-In" play is $5 for those who don't play in the league, and FREE for those who do.  

Once you arrive just check in at the "trailer" by court one, and if you need to pay the $5 fee, or have any questions, you can do so there.
results.name: "Drop-In" Beach Volleyball for all levels of play

results.description:
Gregg[masked]

Two groups (if enough folks are present)

Level 1 (Beginner)

This event is for those who have paddled some, taken classes, or been on short (up to 4-mile) trips and are able to do a wet exit.

Level 2 (Advanced Beginner)

This event is for those who have been on longer trips (up to 10 miles, full day outings), have some experience with winds, waves and currents, and have good rescue and group-paddling skills.

Annual opening day, this time at WatersEdge Park(Peach Orchard Park) ! Let's get BACK into the water :)

As ALWAYS, please plan to arrive at least 1/2 hour early, so we can be ON THE WATER at 10 am., or you will be left behind ! Stay tuned to weather /conditions updates here.

Bay temps are probably at about 60 degrees for this paddle. Wet suits / Cold Gear will likely not be required, but as a reminder, Please avoid cotton as it takes forever to dry and offers little insulation! Quick dry clothing (e.g. synthetics) is essential and a change of clothes in a dry bag is always a good idea! There is no magical temperature at which the water is "safe". BE PREPARED ! You will not be allowed to join a paddle if you show up without appropriate attire.

(You can learn more about cold water gear here:

http://www.meetup.com/Chesapeake-Kayak-Adventures/messages/boards/thread/38728872)

PARKING : Changing the put-in point to WatersEdge Beach-Peach Orchard Park for better parking ! Park by the ballfields/ basketball courts. Put-in at Beach near fishing pier. Please carpool if you can because we have a BIG turnout ! :) If any experienced paddlers want to start EARLIER (paddle over and meet the main group) and park at Turner's Station or Inverness Park, please let us know below. This will help lighten the load of cars at Peach Orchard Park/WatersEdge Beach.


We will go out after for food and brew after the paddles ! :)

The WatersEdge Organizers want everyone to understand that If you want to loan your personal equipment out to a completely unknown member, understand that they may lose or damage it. A better idea would be to do it when the water Temps are much warmer, or be prepared to possibly be held responsible for putting a total stranger in a dangerous predicament. Safety must always be our top concern.

PADDLES: we should bring plenty of radios to communicate. We will have at least two groups.

Beginner Group : paddle 5-6 miles up Bear Creek in sheltered waters, maybe a little open water playing at the end, with optional bailout back at Peach Orchard for those who get tired.

Intermediate Group : a more ambitious trip of 6-10 miles , with venturing out into open waters to Fort Carroll, weather permitting .

As we said in our introductory letter, the advantage of being with the group is STAYING with the group. Paddlers MUST remain with their group at all times . (Anyone needing to bail out for medical or other reason must be escorted back by an experienced paddler )

LUNCH after at the Tasty Hard Yacht Cafe !! http://www.hardyacht.com/

By RSVP’ing YES to this event, participants acknowledge that biking, kayaking, and other WatersEdge activities can be dangerous and result in injury, and each member agrees to accept full responsibility for his or her own personal conduct and safety.

Kayaking involves known and unanticipated risks which may include, but are not limited to, pain, suffering, physical injury, death and economic or emotional loss, which participants may suffer during, or travelling to and from this activity. By voluntarily participating in this activity, participants acknowledge these risks and agree to hold harmless WatersEdge Kayak Club Meetup Group and its Organizers and leaders against any and all claims, suits or actions of any kind for any damages, liabilities or compensation brought by the participant or anyone acting on behalf of the participant.

Participants must be responsible for their own safety and should educate themselves through instructional courses about safety, rescue techniques, navigation, and protection from the elements and weather (both hot and cold). Participants should stick with the group to enhance their own personal safety and follow instructions from the trip leaders. Following the above guidelines will help make kayaking the safe enjoyable outdoor endeavor it should be.
results.name: Annual Opening Day at WatersEdge Beach! Come One, Come All !

results.description:
Enhance the ability to be present and carefully observe the world by joining this interactive book club! It’s a hybrid of book discussion and contemplative photography practices. We will read and discuss “The Practice of Contemplative Photography: Seeing the World with Fresh Eyes” by Andy Karr and Michael Wood and complete the photography exercises as introduced in the text. We will also share each other's photos. This is a casual book club, not a class. Five meetings will take place.

You do not need to have a background in meditation or photography to attend. All are welcome. 

We will get together from 10 AM—12 PM on the following Saturdays: May 14, May 21, June 11, June 18, and July 9. 

This group is facilitated by Donna Whicher, a student of the Gampopa Center’s Spiritual Director Lama Phurbu Tashi Rinpoche. 

The first meeting will serve as an introduction to contemplative photography. We will discuss the first five chapters of the text. Next, we will venture outside to photograph the colors of the streetscapes within walking distance of our meeting place, the Gampopa Center, located at 424 Fourth Street, Annapolis.

A camera is required. iPhone/SmartPhone/iPad cameras are acceptable but not recommended. Please bring a laptop. If you do not have a laptop, you may be able to share one with a fellow participant. You will need the ability to transfer your photos to your laptop or your flash drive.

The book is available at http://www.amazon.com/Practice-Contemplative-Photography-Seeing-World/dp/1590307798/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1460671660&sr=1-1&keywords=contemplative+photography.

There is no fee, but donations to the Gampopa Center for the use of the meeting space are appreciated.

Please RSVP by emailing [masked].

results.description:
Workshop Astro-Magination :  Using Imagery and Imagination in Astrological Counseling with Patricia Walsh

“The work of the eyes is done. Go now and do the heart-work on the images imprisoned within you.”………Rainer Maria Rilke

We live in an era of exponential change. Most astrologers have discussed the recent Pluto/Uranus squares [masked]) from a variety of viewpoints, but with one common thread: we are experiencing the need for deep transformational…radical change.  What about the way we practice astrology?

In its noblest sense, Astrology’s potential is to restore cosmic connection where there has been estrangement. Not only to bring collective cohesion, one human psyche at a time, but to also rekindle faith in a benevolent, harmonious and synchronistic universe….but we cannot lead others where we have not been ourselves.

In this workshop you will learn fresh ‘experiential’ techniques to apply to your own learning and the way you practice astrology.  This workshop is designed to bring you into direct relationship with the living soul of the archetypes we call planets and signs. We will explore the principles of synchronicity and imagination and its uses in both astrological learning and counseling. Drawing from Indigenous Dream Work, Shamanic Journeying, Jungian Active Imagination, Gestalt, Psychodrama/AstroDrama and Guided Imagery, Patricia will guide you in experiencing and learning techniques where , rather than talking ‘about’ the chart, you become the “Midwife”…. the one who ‘holds the space’ inviting the inherent wisdom of the cosmos itself, to birth greater awareness and  consciousness for others.

A taste of things covered:

Opening to and inviting synchronicity in your lifeDaytime/Twilight/Night time consciousnessInvoking and guiding Imagery for yourself and clientsGestalt techniques / Dialogue with PlanetsRole Play to understand intrapsychic tensions and to facilitate creative resolutionAboriginal understanding of working with dreams, visions and imageryJourneying with ‘sprit animals’ as carriers of astrological and archetypal wisdomAnd more………….

Private regression sessions will be possible on Sunday.  Please contact Patricia to discuss cost and times available:
(845)[masked]

Place: Kitty's Home

Date:  Sat May 14

Time: 10 am - 5pm

Cost: Members of Baltimore NCGR: $60; non-members: $70

 Who We Are

Pay at the Door (cash or check) OR

Pay online at  http://www.baltimoreastrology.org/baspaypal.php

About Patricia:

Patricia is a certified Deep Memory Process (DMP)®  regression practitioner (since 2002) and is the Chief US Trainer for Dr. Roger Woolger’s institute of Deep Memory Process.  She worked personally with Dr. Woolger, leading and co-teaching trainings in both Ancestral spirit work and Regression since 2003. She is also a graduate of the Jeffrey Wolf Green School of Evolutionary Astrology (2004) and is a certified Evolutionary Astrologer.

She is the author of  ‘Understanding Karmic Complexes : Evolutionary Astrology and Regression Therapy’  (The Wessex Astrologer, 2009).  She is also a contributing author to ‘ Insights Into Evolutionary Astrology : A Diverse Collections of Essays by Prominent Astrologers”  ( Llewellyn, 2010)

Frequently seen hanging around podiums as a lecturer and keynote speaker at NORWAC, UAC, ISAR, SOTA, various NCGR chapters and Astrological societies,  Balkan Astrology Conference (Serbia), Edmonton Astrology Conference (CAN), Romania, Vancouver, London and Australia.

Combined with astrology, she specializes in multi-dimensional healing work based in Shamanic principles including; Soul Retrieval/Fragmentation and Spirit Releasement (Ancestral and Earthbound Spirit work). Her focus is in healing present and past life trauma synthesizing both intuitive hands-on healing and therapeutic approaches.

Private sessions also available in Sarasota FL. Check my workshop schedule, I travel regularly, if I'm in an area near you, I may be able to schedule sessions.

The training program in Professional Past Life Regression is ongoing please see my Calendar. [masked]

Website: http://www.healthepast.com/

results.description:
Laid Back Saturday Social Paddle from Scott's Cove on Rocky Gorge

The actual attendance limit for this paddle is 30 paddlers.  8 spots have been set aside for people who will be renting kayaks.  If you are a renter on the waiting list I will move you to the attending list.   Those spots not filled by renters 24 hours before the paddle will be filled with members on the waiting list who have paid the voluntary dues.  Everyone has the same chance to sign up for the first 22 slots.

The good news is that the air temps will hit 70 degrees under partly sunny blue skies and the rain for the day isn't supposed to happen until later in the day.  

Start the weekend off the weekend is style with this CKA laid back social paddle.  Bring a snack for yourself and perhaps something to share with the group for a break at about midpoint in the paddle.  

We'll be launching from the Scott's Cove Recreation Area on Rocky Gorge Reservoir promptly at 11:00 AM.  Plan to arrive with plenty of time to have your boat and gear ready to be on the water by then.

Rocky Gorge Reservoir is owned by the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission (WSSC). To paddle here you MUST purchase a $6.00 day use permit or a $70.00 season permit. With over 13 miles of water between Triadelphia and Rocky Gorge Reservoirs and 7 different kayak launch sites we'll visit the WSSC properties often during the season and I suspect regular paddlers in the area will find that the season pass will pay for itself quickly. You can purchase day or season permits on line and print them out at home. Look under permits at the WSSC website located here http://www.wsscwater.com

There are rental kayaks available for this paddle at special weekend price of $45.00. Please answer the rental question when you RSVP to request one.
results.name: Laid Back Saturday Social Paddle - Rocky Gorge - Scott's Cove

results.description:
What’s a property really worth? Learn the right way to do comps, at the next:

Strategies South Meeting  

Special presentation by Addy Watson,investor-friendly real estate agent An ideal meeting for our friends to the south of Baltimore — no more fighting Beltway traffic! Join us from points north, too.  

At Timbuktu restaurant in Hanover on Saturday, May 14, from 11:00 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. Just $25 for Baltimore REIA members and $44 for non-members. Includes lunch!  Sign up now (see below) and lock in your place.  

Attention rehabbers! 

To pay the right price for a property, you must know what it will be worth afteryou rehab it.  In other words, you must be reasonably certain about — not just guess at — the comparable sales, or “comps” for short. Attention buy-and-hold investors! Accurate comps are critical for you, too.  If you plan to finance your rental properties, you must know the after-rehab value (ARV) to which the lender’s loan-to-value (LTV) ratio will apply. Let Addy Watson show you how to do “like kind” comps.  

This experienced realtor will reveal how value is affected by: 

• Gross living area.  What percentage of difference is close enough?  How can you make adjustments?  What counts as “living area,” anyway? 

• Quality of construction and finishes. Are you comparing brick to siding?  Granite to laminate?  Hardwood to carpet? Don’t kid yourself, or it can negatively impact your bottom line.

• Basements.  Is there one?  Is it finished?  All or part of it?  Does any of it count toward gross living area?  Does that lonely toilet count as a half-bath?  Thousands of dollars are at stake here.

About Addy Watson: Addy is a veteran realtor who enjoys working with investors. She provides accurate comps for investors who are buying and selling properties… teaches investors how to do their own comps… finds suitable properties for investors who want to rehab or buy-and-hold… and helps investors sell their properties. The bottom line: every investor must master comps. Your profit is in the balance, so come and learn from masterful Addy Watson! Sign up now for the Strategies South meeting. The price includes your meal, with several choices of entrees, plus soft drinks, tax, and tip.  (Bar drinks are extra.)  Yes, you can pay at the door, but why not spend less time in line and more time networking?

     Not a member?

Join Baltimore REIA now

. You’ll pay the lower price to attend this meeting, save on our other meetings, save on classes, and get vendor discounts including a 2% rebate from Home Depot.  Plus a FREE welcome kit with $197 worth of DVDs.  About the Strategies South meeting One of several satellite meetings from Baltimore REIA, Strategies South typically brings you a presentation by one or more local experts.  You’ll learn plenty from other investors in the room as well. We started this meeting for the convenience of our friends to the south of Baltimore.  Thanks to the quality of the presentations, attendees come from far and wide, so arrive early and network.  You may even do a deal.  DATE AND AGENDA:  The meeting is from 11:00 to 1:30 p.m., usually on the second Saturday of the month.  The first half-hour you can order your food and beverage, and network with your fellow investors.  The presentation begins around 11:30, with time for Q&A.   LOCATION:

results.description:
UPDATE 9/2/15   

***THIS TRIP IS SOLD OUT***

ORIGINAL POST


Cuba!! This is the time to visit Cuba our mysterious (to Americans) yet closest neighbors to our south. Until now, Cuba was the only country in the world off-limits to U.S. visitors… so time to go – now!


This is the trip for you if you’re interested in Cuba’s culture and its people rather than beach resorts. Our one-week itinerary is optimized to sample some of the most interesting areas of Cuba.

The tour takes your from the bustling and vibrant Havana, to its neighbors to the east and west including the historic Santa Clara, and gives you the chance to experience the more traditional and rural sides of Cuba, with stays in Trinidad, Cienfuegos and Viñales.

These places are the top favorites for travelers who have come to Cuba seeking authentic cultural experiences. While Trinidad presents us with beautiful white sand beaches, colonial architecture, waterfalls, and a charming village atmosphere, Viñales offers stunning mountainous scenery, sprawling tobacco fields and friendly locals.

This is a small group trip with no more than 12 people to allow us to travel around in a more independent, intimate way.

Why is Cuba so special?

For many travelers, Cuba ends up being an unforgettable and unique experience.

Cuba, with its mix of Spanish and African roots, is the largest, least commercialized, and most exciting island in the Caribbean. It is also one of the world’s last bastions of communism with a fascinating modern history.

Cuba’s relative political isolation has prevented it from being overrun by tourists, and locals are sincerely friendly to those who do venture in.

Perhaps this isolation from the more modern world has helped conserve the personality of the Cuban society. Cuba definitely feels like the pulsating heart of what it means to be Latino, with music, dance, and the fiesta being core to this.

Much of Latin America’s music and dance seems to originate in Cuba and likewise could be said about the Latino persona. Once visiting Cuba, many start to see the rest of Latin America as, culturally, a watered down version of Cuba.

Cubans can be described as gregarious, loud, expressive, open, warm, generous, and extremely friendly people – kind of like an Italian, or a Spaniard, but with added spices. To be immersed in this culture can be an exhilarating and uplifting experience.

Cuba seems to be lost in time, somewhere in the 1950’s. It’s not just the old American cars in the streets or the exquisite colonial architecture with peeling paint in Old Havana.

Instead, it’s a sense that the world of modern tourism has somehow largely bypassed the Caribbean’s largest island. This mixture makes Cuba an undeniably enticing destination.

Why go now?

Located only 80 miles south of Key West FL, Americans have not been allowed to visit from the U.S. for more than five decades. Because of its new accessibility, Cuba is understandably a hot destination where Americans will be pouring into soon.

The “real” Cuba as it is right now will be transformed into a touristy destination that will not resemble its current, authentic condition.

However, at the moment, there is still limited transportation options into Cuba, very little infrastructure to accommodate the tremendous influx of expected visitors, and still a fair amount of confusion & many details to iron out with our newly restored economic ties between the U.S. and Cuba.

There is a small window of opportunity – predicted to close as soon as the latter part of next year – where relatively small numbers of travelers will visit as things continue to be figured out & the tourism industry works to get organized.

Our small, nimble, quick on their feet group is ready to move-out now while the window is still open to visit the authentic, pre-tourism Cuba. Clearly… the time to go is now.

This trip will be led by a fantastic, fully licensed, People-to-People small group tour operator who is authorized to work with American clients and has designed an itinerary to give you the most authentic, educational, and enjoyable introduction to this fascinating and complex country.

Go here to reserve your spot on our Cuba adventure (fill out the booking form & pay a 30% deposit) & get all trip details: http://www.yoloworldtravel.com/cuba/

This trip is limited to 12 travelers maximum. First come, First serve. You must be one fill out the booking form & pay the 30% deposit to be officially signed up.

This is a combined meetup trip for the Baltimore Gen X Travel Club and Washington DC Gen X Travel club.
results.name: SOLD OUT - Cuba Trip!! May 2016

results.description:
Soldiers Delight Natural Environment Area (NEA) is comprised of 1,900 acres of serpentine barren. The area has over 39 rare, threatened, or endangered plant species as well as rare insects, rocks and minerals.

Rare grassland plant species are threatened by invasion of Virginia Pines. Currently, a five year effort of removing 1,000 acres of pines and prescribed burning are underway to return the area to natural serpentine habitat.

There are seven miles of marked hiking trails. Equestrians and cyclists are prohibited due to the sensitive nature of the area. The visitor center has meeting rooms, a reference library and exhibits on the natural and cultural history of the area. The visitor center is located at 5100 Deer Park Road in Owings Mills, Maryland, 21117. The Visitor Center is open Saturdays from 11 a.m. to 3 p.m. (weather permitting). Sunday through Friday, the Visitor Center will be open only when staff is available.

Afterwards, we can find a local place to eat.
results.name: Lunch and a Hike at Soldiers Delight Natural Environment Area

results.description:
Ciao a tutti!

This is a different type of Meetup than what we have held in the past. We are not meeting to just practice the Italian language. Instead, we are holding a meeting to talk about and celebrate BEING Italian. 

I have talked with so many of you since starting this group who have amazing stories about your and your family's experiences as part of the greater Italian American experience. I'd like to meet for an informal chat in which we have the opportunity to share these stories. My hope is that this Meetup will spark ideas for others of a similar nature. 

Again, the goal is for this to be informal and FUN. We're Italian, so no matter how much we may plan in advance, when we get together and start chatting, there's no telling where it will go! To help us attempt to organize, give some thought to the following questions and feel free to share when we meet: '

1. The thing I love most about being Italian is...(don't be shy!)
2. My favorite Italian Americanisms/Italian American slang are... (this is going to be good!)
3. My proudest Italian/Italian American moment was...(so looking forward to these!)
4. If there is one thing I hope the next generation of those with Italian heritage maintains and celebrates, it would be...(can't wait to hear these either!)

This is for ALL ages and "generations" - 1st, 2nd, 3rd - and "percentages." If you identify as being Italian, know a lot about it or you're curious about learning more about it, come join us.

Even if you can't make it this Saturday, please feel free to share some of your own answers and ideas in the comments section below. You're a member of this group, whether you can attend or not!

Finally, you do not have to have Italian heritage to attend. All are welcome. As long as you understand what you'll be a part of. It's likely we're going to get off track, but that's the fun of it. We won't get so off track that an eavesdropper couldn't tell the general reason for the Meetup, that I can assure you!

Any questions, please let me know. And please do RSVP so we know how many to plan for.

I know it's a bit short notice, but I'm hoping 3:30 pm on a rainy Saturday can work for at least a few people.
results.name: Siamo Italiani - We Are Italian

group.name: Ciao Amici! - Everything Italian & Italian-American Meetup

Can a small group of heroes and would-be rebels stand against the might of the Thrice-Damned House of Thrune and the Church of Asmodeus and save their home town from being crushed under the boot of an infernal tyrant? Will one of Cheliax's most powerful inquisitors make the city his playground, or can the rebels known as the Silver Ravens rise up to bring a new era of freedom to the so called Silver City of Kintargo? Join the rebellion! Save Kintargo! DOWN WITH THRUNE!

Peter Pan is a 1954 musical adaptation of J. M. Barrie's 1904 play Peter Pan and Barrie's own novelization of it, Peter and Wendy. Broadway's timeless classic musical whisks you away to a place where dreams are born and no one ever grows up!  Come along for a fun journey back to our childhoods.

The music is mostly by Mark "Moose" Charlap, with additional music by Jule Styne, and most of the lyrics were written by Carolyn Leigh, with additional lyrics by Betty Comden and Adolph Green. Featuring the iconic songs from our youth - "I Won't Grow Up," "I'm Flying," "I Gotta Crow," and "Never Never Land."

results.description:
I apologize for cancelling this event this month.  I was just offered a great opportunity that I chose not to turn down.  The drum circle will continue next month.  

Bring your prayers and intentions.  We encourage you to bring your drums or other percussion instruments.  If you don't have any, we have plenty to share. 

A drum circle is a fun experience that is accessible to anyone who wants to participate regardless of age or experience level. The goal is to achieve oneness with a group, not rhythmic perfection.  This is not a professional group, we do this for fun and release.  Children are welcome and I have purchased some instruments specifically for kids. 

Shamanism is the oldest spiritual belief system on earth. Drumming has been a method of group healing and achieving unity since the beginning of time. Studies have shown that drumming accelerates physical healing, boosts the immune system and produces feelings of well-being.

The drum circle will be held every 2nd Saturday of the month from 7:00 to 8:30. 

A $10 donation would be appreciated. No one will be turned away if finances are an issue. All are welcome.
results.how_to_find_us: Next to Nautilus Diner immediately off of York Road.
results.name: Cancelled - Drum Circle
