results.description:
One of the best kept secrets here just north of Towson is the public access to a "protected" area of Loch Raven Reservoir park on the weekend.  On both Saturday and Sunday, park police close off Loch Raven Drive (some maps call it Loch Raven Rd.) between Morgan Mill Road and Providence Road. The road becomes a recreational area for walking, running, biking, and the like.  In the warmer months, many people picnic or just relax on blankets and chairs along the water.  The views of the water and the surrounding wooded areas are wonderful all year round.

It is an "out and back" hike, can't possibly get lost, bite off as much as you want to chew.

The total distance is approximately 3 and 1/2 miles which we complete in roughly 1 hour, so that you can probably be home before noon, if you want to. But also feel free to stay as long as you like.

 Loch Raven is city reservoir property. It, technically, is not a park at all. In other words, no potty facilities, no pavilions, etc. What you see is what you get. So......take care of business before you get there.

To get there, if you are travelling north on Dulaney Valley Rd. from the Beltway, the road splits just after crossing a large bridge over the lake. Dulaney Valley Rd. is the one that continues to the right toward the east. That's what you want. Don't go up the hill which is Jarrettsville Pike.

Travel on Dulaney Valley Road for roughly another mile or so. You will enter the park from the north. To do so, you bear right/make a right hand turn from Dulaney Valley Rd onto Loch Raven Drive at the corner where Peerce's Plantation/Landing/Grille (the name depends on who owns it this week; it's had some turnover in recent years) is located.  Peerce's address is 12460 Dulaney Valley Road 21131. If your GPS is telling you to go farther north on Dulaney Valley Rd past Peerce's, it's just plain wrong !!! Once you enter the park, the meeting place is about a mile down the road.

This hike will begin at the road closure gate at the corner of Loch Raven Drive and Morgan Mill Road. Parking is allowed on the west side of Loch Raven Drive and there is a sort of a parking lot on Morgan Mill Road.

When you see this sign, you've found the right place.  We'll meet right behind it, by where you see the guy/rock. 

Loch Raven Drive is a normal, well paved road, so there is no need for "off road" footwear unless you choose to get adventurous and challenge the rather steep hills that surround the lake.  That is certainly an option for those who are more experienced and confident.  However, I am not aware of any sanctioned, prepared trails in that area of Loch Raven and can't recommend it.  It would be free style.

I will not post cancellations because of the weather. I assume we're all capable of making that decision as each of us sees fit.

If you decide to respond "Yes" to this event and later change your mind for whatever reason, please,please go in and change your RSVP to a "No". That way, we know not to be waiting for you. Thanks.

So come join us on Sunday for a brisk walk in the park. It's a great way to clean out the cobwebs and start a Sunday.
results.how_to_find_us: Please read the directions below carefully. We do NOT meet at Peerce's. That's just a landmark along the way.
results.name: Loch Raven Beginner Hike

results.description:
Come out and play!!  

Enjoy the beach; get some sand between your toes (and maybe in your ears if you like to dive.)


Baltimore Beach Volleyball would love for you to come check out one of Baltimore's hidden gems, seven courts of beach volleyball with water views! Most Saturdays, and Sundays, you can come brush up on your volleyball skills, learn some new ones, and make some new friends along the way playing coed doubles, fours, and sixes volleyball.  Baltimore Beach welcomes all skill levels, so don't worry if it has been a few years since you have bumped, set, spiked a volleyball.

None of your friends play volleyball, but you want to play?  No problem!  If you don't have enough people to make a team you can just join in with other teams, and people, already there.

If you find that you like the feel of sand between your toes while getting some exercise and making new friends, and want to play during the week, you can also join a Baltimore Beach Volleyball league.  Leagues play every night of the week,  more information can be found at: Information on Baltimore Beach Leagues 

Cost for all day "Drop-In" play is $5 for those who don't play in the league, and FREE for those who do.  

Once you arrive just check in at the "trailer" by court one, and if you need to pay the $5 fee, or have any questions, you can do so there.
results.name: "Drop-In" Beach Volleyball for all levels of play

results.description:
Couch to 5K (C25K) is a fantastic program that's been designed to get just about anyone from the couch to running 5 kilometers (or 30 minutes) in just 9 weeks!


Every Sunday, let's meet and do a training run as part of the C25K program! During the week, you will perform 2 runs on your own (as per the C25K program guidelines, which you can follow with a free iPhone/Android app), and then we'll do one run together every Sunday. Accountability buddies are the best!

Can't wait to see you!
results.how_to_find_us: Everyone please park on WB&A Blvd., and meet at the corner of WB&A and Dorsey (at the stop light). Look for the group of people that have 2 kids in a double jogger. =)

results.description:
This is a pretty, scenic, low-traffic  ride that meets in the Davidsonville park and ride lot. Because the start is conveniently located for so many people, the ride is usually well attended.

To top it off, Bike & Brunch goes to the always-popular Mike's Restaurant on the South River after the ride!

Ride 25 or 37 miles. Gentle-Moderate Hills 

From I-495, take US 50 east towards Annapolis for 10 miles. Take Exit 16, MD 424. Bear LEFT on the exit ramp North to Crofton. Continue straight into the Park and Ride lot.
Meet at 10:00, leave promptly at 10:30

All riders must wear a helmet and sign a Bike & Brunch release form.

You should also bring plenty of water for the ride, money and identification.

If you need a car ride, please indicate that on your RSVP. Many people go through the city to get to this ride, so rides may be more convenient.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for the other bicyclists in the Park & Ride parking lot.
results.name: Anne Arundel Adventure, Great Ride and Lunch on the South River!

results.description:
The Prince George's Trap and Skeet Center is a premier shooting facility rated one of the highest in the mid-atlantic region. You can bring your own gun and ammo or rent and buy ammo at the retail center.


General Info
Onsite Shotgun Rental $10.00 w/ valid driver's license
Ammunition- 12 gauge 7 1/2 shot (25 shells for $8)
Programs available for all ages.
Beginner's programs are given by certified instructors to offer a safe introduction to the sport.
$22 pays for 1 round of 50 sporting clay targets
**All prices include tax.

Location/Directions
We're located in Glenn Dale, adjacent to Goddard Space Flight Center and the Beltsville Agricultural Research Center.

From the Capital Beltway (I-495), take Exit 22A to the Baltimore-Washington Parkway. Proceed 400 yards and take Greenbelt Road exit (Route 193) east. Continue through eight traffic lights and make a left onto Good Luck Road, then turn right at the next traffic light to continue on Good Luck Road. The facility is located .07 miles on the left.


Call me if you get lost on my cell at[masked]-1144.
results.name: Learn how to shoot a shotgun and sporting clays

results.description:
Lynne Cherry, Co-founder, Young Voices on Climate Change


Lynne Cherry will share her experiences with educating children, tomorrow’s leaders, about the importance of protecting our natural environment.


Bio

Lynne Cherry is the founder and director of the non-profit Young Voices on Climate Change, an organization dedicated to helping the voices of environmentally-concerned young people be heard. Lynne is also a movie producer. Her Young Voices for the Planet short films feature youth success stories: California kids helping to get a ban on plastic bags; Florida students saving their school $53,000 in energy costs; An 11-year old German boy planting a million trees… and many more. Cherry's books and movies are inspired by her love of the natural world. She speaks widely-and passionately about how children can make a difference.  Learn more at http://www.youngvoicesonclimatechange.com/ .
results.name: Sunday Platform: Teaching Children About  Climate Change Activism

We will hike about 4miles maybe. 

Typically we are finish by 12:30-1pm.

You might get muddy on the trails, so dress accordingly.

results.description:
http://www.meetup.com/csa-com/

WE ARE STILL IN NEED OF PEOPLE. WE HAVE TO PAY FOR 35. IF WE GET MORE, GREAT RESTAURANTS DON'T TURN AWAY PEOPLE, THEY JUST MAKE ROOM FOR YOU. It may be a little to windy to go out today. But we can at least get you on one of the sailing or power boats and meet the skippers.

May is usually a perfect month for sailing with fair winds and plenty of sun! For a perfect opportunity to meet the CSA skippers and other fellow members, please join us for a Buffet Brunch at the Riverwatch marina/restaurant on the beautiful Middle River. This event is open to both members and non-members so feel free to bring your friends who may be interested in finding out more about our club.  We ask that all attendees, including guests, RSVP so we can get an accurate count to give to the restaurant.  For non-members, please first join the CSA Meetup website at no cost so you can RSVP! 

The cost of the Buffet is $25 per person. Payment can be made at the door. Please pay using cash or check. (No credit cards, please)  You can also pay the event fee of $25 by PayPal ahead of time by following the instructions at the following link:

http://files.meetup.com/1639607/CSA%20Fee%20%26%20Dues%20Payment%20Instructions%20%20.pdf 

We hope to have several CSA boat-owners there with their boats, so there may be a possibility to go for a boat ride (either sail or motorboat) after the brunch, but we cannot guarantee a ride!  Preference will be given to paid members of the CSA. 

We will also be accepting annual dues payments for new members and renewing current members at the discounted rate of $35, instead of the usual Annual dues of $40 per year, so if you haven't renewed your membership or joined yet, it would be a great time to do so.

 Since the restaurant needs to know an exact number, attendees and their guests must RSVP by May 7th and make a firm commitment to honor that RSVP, if at all possible.  The CSA club will be subsidizing some of the cost of the brunch, including tax and gratuity and the cost of the bartender.  

The plans for sailing this year include at least 4 overnight cruises, crewing Learning Sessions at the dock as we had last year, and an effort to have a number of day sails. This event is a perfect way to start the fun sailing season, so we look forward to seeing you all there!

Buffet Menu:

Shrimp Scampi over rice,

Roast pork with gravy,

Baked Chicken,

Tossed salad, Red Bliss Potatoes,

Hot Rolls, butter, coffee, tea, soda,

With Brownies & Cookies for dessert.


http://www.riverwatchrestaurant.com/index.php
results.how_to_find_us: We will be in a private back room. Call me if ur coming because the restaurant wants to know how many will be there. We paid for 35 and maybe able to take a few more. norm 443-683-3830
results.name: ANNUAL 'MEET & GREET' AT RIVERWATCH MARINA/RESTAURANT with Buffet

Got amazing upper body strength? If you got it, flaunt it!

Let try out the open climb with earth treks.

The spots are limited so if you can not make it, please change your RSVP - 

From the website.
Cost: $25 ; The open climb pass includes 3 climbs, a harness rental, and an Earth Treks instructor to lead your climbing experience. Three climbs will give you a great taste of climbing, but if you enjoyed them so much you want to try more that day, they’re just $5 each.* It’s that simple! * Please note, extra climbs may not be available during peak hours.

All climbers under the age of 18 must have our Release of Liability and Assumption of Risks Form signed by a parent or court-appointed legal guardian, or they will not be permitted to climb in any Earth Treks program.

Please limit your group size to five or fewer. Larger groups may be better served by booking a private climbing party.

We can grab something to eat after!

results.description:
It's a

Potluck Luncheon!!

 Bring food to share and join the group that is

"Singles With Grace"

at Grace Community Church

for their monthly potluck luncheon.

We eat, we socialize, we hang out and a few games might be played.

There is a lot of opportunity to mix, mingle, meet other singles and make friends at these monthly potlucks.  We usually have an icebreaker game to get us talking to one another.

We start gathering for the luncheon (setting up tables, chairs and such) around  12:45 PM with the goal of beginning to eat around 1:00 PM.

Directions and MAP (click link)

If you enter the church from the first parking lot that you come to, the Grace Place area is on the opposite side of the church.  Walk through the lobby to the opposite end and you will see Grace Place.  (You can also ask at one of the information desks.)  If you park around back of the church and enter through those doors, the Grace Place area will be on your left as you enter the building.

Bring a potluck dish to share.

A potluck dish is a substantial main dish, salad or side/dessert item.

Across the street from the church, there is a Harris Teeter grocery store and about 1/2 mile away at one of the traffic circles is a Food Lion grocery store.  This may be an option if you are coming from your church's worship service and need to pick up an item to contribute to the potluck.

You can also pick up take out food - a bucket of chicken or side items, a few sub sandwiches of $5 footlongs from Subway, a carry out order of chinese food - you don't have to cook....although delicious homemade casseroles and salads are much appreciated!!

Grace does not have refrigerators or microwaves (yet) that we can use to keep items cold or to heat them.  Kitchen is coming soon, hopefully later in 2014!

Usually there are 60 to 75 single men and women who regularly attend these monthly luncheons, both from Grace Community Church and from our Meetup group.

Check out some photos from previous luncheons - click the link below -

Outdoors:

PHOTOS FROM THE LUNCHEON ON JULY 17th

PHOTOS FROM THE LUNCHEON ON AUGUST 21st

Indoors:

PHOTOS FROM THE LUNCHEON ON DECEMBER 16th

PHOTOS FROM THE LUNCHEON ON NOVEMBER 18th

Note - This is the church that Michelle, Mike and some of the other Organizers regularly attend.  Posting this event is in no way an attempt to take you away from your home church.  Please attend your church's worship service on Sunday morning and then join us for the luncheon.

If you do not have a regular church and/or want to use this as an opportunity to visit Grace, please contact one of us and we will coordinate with you to meet you in the lobby at 11:00 AM.

The Singles With Grace group normally sits together during the 11:15 service.  We sit about halfway down the far right section when facing the stage.  If you arrive after 11:15 and want to sit with us, look for the group in that area.

Website of Grace Community Church

CLICK LINK for Directions and MAP

DRIVING DIRECTIONS -- Don't rely solely on plugging the church's address into your GPS if you have never been to the church before.  Some GPS devices don't like this address or they find it on a section of Old Columbia Road where the church is NOT actually located.

Grace Community Church is located in Fulton, Maryland, between Baltimore and Washington, DC, south of Columbia, on Old Columbia Road off of MD 216 just west of US 29.

From Columbia
Take US Route 29 south to MD 216. Take MD 216 west. After you exit US 29, you will go through a traffic circle. Follow the signs to take MD 216 west. Proceed through a second traffic circle.  Go around a third traffic circle and exit to the right onto Old Columbia Road.  The church entrance is the first right.

From Baltimore
Take I-95 south to MD 216. Take MD 216 west, Exit 35B Scaggsville. In a little over 2 miles, go through a traffic circle and cross US 29. Proceed through two more traffic circles.  Go around the fourth traffic circle and exit to the right onto Old Columbia Road.  The church entrance is the first right.

From Washington, DC
Take I-95 north to MD 216. Take MD 216 west, Exit 35B Scaggsville. In a little over 2 miles, go through a traffic circle and cross US 29. Proceed through two more traffic circles.  Go around the fourth traffic circle and exit to the right onto Old Columbia Road.  The church entrance is the first right.
results.how_to_find_us: OUTSIDE!  In the pavilion at the rear of the church.  However, please keep an eye on the weather - if it is raining or rain is eminent, we'll try to move inside.  I will post any changes here.
results.name: Monthly Singles Potluck Luncheon  - UPDATE: inside in Kid Zone

Can you find the source of the madness and save yourself and the village’s inhabitants? A four-hour adventure for 5th-10th level characters.
results.name: DDEX 3-8 Malady of Elventree

results.description:
Sunday is supposed to be partly sunny & 65 degrees with a 0% chance of rain.  Yippee!  Let's walk doggies together :)


**Note:  Please bring adequate water for your dog.**

Most of this walk is along the paved Columbia pathways; it is shaded and has a lot of hills. A short 1/4-mile section will be along a street in a quiet neighborhood.  For any of our first timers, it's a 2-mile walk along a shaded paved trail in Columbia's Clary's Forest area, which borders the Middle Patuxent Environmental Area. The trail runs alongside a stream most of the way, and passes a large pond where turtles and other wildlife hang out. There  is a "tot lot" and a resting bench along the way for water breaks.


WHERE TO MEET


Park in the Clarys Forest Pool lot and meet at the furthest in spot by the path

SAFETY AND COURTESY

Please arrive a few minutes early to allow the dogs to greet one another and form their pack.  Please change your RSVP if you aren't going to attend.  We will step off promptly at the start time.

There may be joggers, bikers or other dog walkers on the path.  If you see them coming from behind or ahead, please call out "On your left!" to remind us to get single file to the RIGHT of the path, so our dogs and leashes won't trip others.  If you see a bike, call out "Bike!"  You may add "Up" for a bike coming from our front.  Bikes are especially dangerous to dogs if they catch their snout in the spokes.

We would like to keep the group together for safety and the pleasure of your company.  Therefore if your dog is pausing for the call of nature, call out so that everyone will pause and wait for you :)

Photos by J. Ameen-Lee

PLEASE READ:

Columbia Dogs on the Go provides a way for friendly people to meet others with friendly dogs (no growling, snarling, or lunging please) on a voluntary basis. By replying "Yes" to this RSVP and attending this event, you acknowledge that:

•  You are responsible for your own safety and the safety of your dogs and any guests. 

•  Your dogs are current on their vaccinations.

•  Your dogs will be kept on a fixed length leash (non-retractable) and under your control at the Meetup.

•  You will clean up after your dogs at the Meetup.

•  You will update your RSVP if your plans change.

•  You understand that the Meetup ends when the walk ends. (If you choose to meet other members at a restaurant, dog park, or other location, it is on your own time and not part of the Meetup event.)


Look forward to seeing you and your dog soon!
results.how_to_find_us: Park in the Clarys Forest Pool lot; we will meet at the end furthest from the entrance.
results.name: Sunday 1:00 p.m. Walk in Clary's Forest

Making vacation plans? Want to get caught up on those vacation memories or get ready for new memories in your scrapbooks? Well come on by and sit with us while you work on your scrapbooks or any other projects you have going on.

results.description:
Quiet Waters Park is a convenient place to go walking in a peaceful natural environment. The park has excellent facilities and is well-laid out with paved trails, picnic pavilions, open fields, water views, and a visitors center that's modern, clean, and comfortable. Our SHR group has gone there several times for kayaking, picnicking, and outdoor concerts. This time we'll be walking around the entire park to see what's there.

Meetup Spot and Parking

Meet at the large gazebo behind the Quiet Waters Park entrance sign. From there we can walk into the park for FREE to enjoy its amenities (the entrance fee for cars is $6.00). Ample parking is available just across Hillsmere Drive in the Bay Ridge Shopping Plaza. After our walk, we'll head for the Annapolis Smokehouse located in the shopping plaza, so you'll be close to your car when we're done.

Walking Around Quiet Waters Park

The walk will be approximately five miles on the paved trails that go around the edge of the park. Most of the trails are framed by large trees and thick woods that make this walk both shady and scenic. Our route will pass the pond used for ice skating, the concert area, a dog park, and the waterfront facing the South River. Real restrooms are available at the visitor's center mid-route.

Our pace will be easy-going to enjoy the natural surroundings while getting a bit of exercise. If you're late, look for us going counter-clockwise (right) around the park. The entire route is basically a big loop with side trails that brings us back to the park entrance. People can go as fast or slow as they want since we'll all end up at the same place afterward. Total time to circle the park and see everything should be about three hours or so.

Afterward at the Annapolis Smokehouse

Following the walk, we'll head to the Annapolis Smokehouse for food and refreshments. It's a popular tavern restaurant located across from Quiet Waters Park in the Bay Ridge Shopping Plaza. The Smokehouse has a full menu that includes BBQ and happy hour specials from 3-7 pm seven days a week. The bar area is large and has a nice ambience. The people are friendly and Jen the owner is a super hostess. 


As a general rule, our SHR group prefers gathering in the bar area where we can freely mingle and get separate checks with no hassles about group ordering. We also receive much better service by ordering and paying directly at the bar.

http://www.annapolissmokehouse.com

Final Details

We'll need good walking weather for this event. A little rain won't stop us, but we won't go in miserable conditions. I'll post an update and send out an email by 10:00 am if we need to change plans or cancel. Call Jake at[masked] to find us. I can't always answer my phone at events, but you can try.

I hope to see you there!
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the Gazebo by the Quiet Waters Park entrance sign
results.name: Trail Walk at Quiet Waters Park & Happy Hour at The Smokehouse

results.description: Panoramic in scope, Away is the epic and intimate story of young Lillian Leyb, a dangerous innocent, an accidental heroine. When her family is destroyed in a Russian pogrom, Lillian comes to America alone, determined to make her way in a new land. When word comes that her daughter, Sophie, might still be alive, Lillian embarks on an odyssey that takes her from the world of the Yiddish theater on New York’s Lower East Side, to Seattle’s Jazz District, and up to Alaska, along the fabled Telegraph Trail toward Siberia. All of the qualities readers love in Amy Bloom’s work–her humor and wit, her elegant and irreverent language, her unflinching understanding of passion and the human heart–come together in the embrace of this brilliant novel, which is at once heartbreaking, romantic, and completely unforgettable.
results.name: Book Discussion of Away by Amy Bloom

results.description:
This will be our standard workshop where folks of all skill levels can come to learn more about photography by doing/practicing with different models on a regular basis quarterly!

One of the most common areas of photography is portraiture, you maybe asked often to take someone's picture. From the new couple, to the new baby, and even the new house hold pet. And from head shots to three quarter, to full length portraits.

Learning how to use the light in different environments, and creating a pose that brings out the persons best is harder than it seems. You may have seen some wonderful poses, and you've probably seen some awkward looking portraits. Knowing the differences of a good pose based on the subjects body type, and how to use light and posing to make your subject feel and look their best is key!

We will be using daylight, flash (mono-lights and speed lights) in the studio and on location at Patterson Park's Pagoda (blocks down the street) weather permitting! We will be creating poses in these different environments to get the best portrait possible.

If you are just starting out or an up and coming shooting looking for know more about your camera, light, and posing for a better portrait this is the workshop for you.

In this month's workshop we will shooting Dasha and Laurese, plus others if needed due to participant count.  

We hope to see you all there!

Meet your Models Dasha and Laurese:
results.how_to_find_us: Skyloft F Rental Studio - Call or text Jeff at 410-733-2219
results.name: "Light - Pose - Portrait" Photography Quarterly Workshop!

results.description:
Let's Meetup at the Park and Let the Kids Play!

At the nearby pavilion we can watch them, as they burn off steam and have fun with friends. I'll bring my boombox if anyone wants to bring CDs.


Oh!  Did I forget to mention that there's a cool bridge next to the playground where the kids can throw and toss rocks into the lake?  Plus, there's an awesome hiking trail next to the river covered by beautiful forest.  Great place to take a small hike with the wee ones (ages 2-5yrs).


CALLING ALL MOMS!  Let's hang out, snack and compare notes.
results.name: Playground Play Date

results.description:
This is a FREE weekly cartooning and animation workshop for students, hobbyists, and professionals.

Come meet other local artists and animators!

ALL AGES WELCOME!

We will be using a new 2d animation program called OpenToonz.

This workshop covers a range of traditional and digital techniques used in comics and animation. learn basic theory and mechanics behind animation. develop observational and drawing skills and study the fundamental principles of story development, character design, layout and storyboarding.

Create a project for fun, for entry into a film festival, or to add to your portfolio.

Come in with an existing project or start something from scratch.

Work independently or with others to complete a cartoon and or animated short film.

*No drawing or animation experience is required.

We have paper, pencils, and laptops available for use.

However, if you have a laptop and wish to bring it with you then that would also be great.

The program that we will be using is free https://opentoonz.github.io/e/ download it and bring your own laptop if you have one.

Also feel free to bring drawing paper and pencils. If you prefer to work with your own supplies.

For more info go to:
https://www.facebook.com/events/1683715821890378/

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me.

results.description:
Are you ready to take a journey to create wealth and abundance in your life? If the answer is Yes, join me in reading our next book: A Happy Pocket Full of MONEY Infinite Wealth and Abundance in the Here and Now by David Cameron Gikandi.

"True wealth is not about buckets of cash. True wealth is not about designer clothes. It is not about a new Mercedes. It is not about living in a palatial estate. True wealth, asserts David Gikandi, is about discovering value within yourself and value within other people. It is about a kind of conscious living that incoroporates gratitude, a belief in abundance, and the experience of joy.

Make a committment to change your life FOREVER! The book discussions will begin... on Sunday, May 1st at 3:00pm EST and continue each Sunday for seven weeks until June 26th (except May 8th, Mother's Day, and June 19th, Father's Day).

May 1 - Chps: 1 Money, 2: Quantum Physics, 3: The Truth about Time

May 15 - Chps: 4 Images of the Mind, 5: Thinking and Speaking; 6: Goals

May 22: Chps: 7 Being; 8: Acting, 9: Certainty

May 29: Chps: 10 Cause and Effect, 11: Conditions, 12: Success

June 5: Chps: 13: Want Not, 14: Purpose, 15: Giving, 16: Gratitude

June 12: Chps: 17: Consciousness, 18: The Self, 19: One

June 26 (last): Chps: 20: Abundance, 21: Happiness, 22: Happiness, 23: Money

Whether you can make them all or just a few, it will be worth opening up your mind to trying something new in order to create the change you want to see in your life. You have to do something different to get something different!

Join the discussion via zoom here: In the
GET READY, IT'S GOING TO BE POWERFUL!

results.description:
Starting November 15, this group will have a weekly language meetup. For this upcoming meetup, the event will likely be held at it's previous location, at Panera Bread in White Marsh. Mind you the location is tentative; Ideally I'd like to find a location that's more central, urban, probably downtown. I will keep you guys posted. If you guys have any suggestions, please let me know. 

Languages confirmed for this meetup will be the following; Spanish, French, Italian, Portuguese, Creole, Krio/Pidgin, and Swahili. That said, I'd also like to encourage new members who speak other languages to come out as well; the more variety the better. 

HOSTS: The idea is to eventually have hosts designated for each language. This way everyone will have an opportunity to practice their language. Imagine being able to practice 10 or more languages in one place; that is the direction in which this group is headed! If you'd like to be a host for this meetup, or have an idea for a future meetup, please let me know. I look forward to seeing you guys next week!

results.description:
It's time to start rides for new comers, or slower riders. Pace: I will try to keep it between 6-7mph. This is strictly for beginners, if you ride anything faster, you will have to be patient with the pace or ride on your own.

Distance: Total, 7ish miles, with an option to bail at around mile 5. We will be skipping the Neighborhood trail, to keep it beginner friendly.

About Fairland: 95% non-technical ride with few major climbs and no mandatory obstacles (they all have ride-arounds). Promise, no rocks. None! (there is one section of busted-up concrete, but it's not rocks, and it's only 10-15 feet long). Anyway, there are a couple good places to stop and practice log-overs, and balance on the boardwalks, and some good flow trails.

Parking by playgrounds and bathrooms.

Wheels rolling by 4:15

What to bring:
Plenty of water, helmet (no helmet no ride), your mtb of course!, multi-tool (although you can borrow mine), patch kit, extra tube (make sure it has the same valve you need for your wheel), a snack if you're doing both loops.

Waiver: Mountain biking is a risky sport, By signing up for this meetup you are agreeing to our waiver located here: http://www.meetup.com/MVD-Mountain-Bikers/pages/Standard_Waiver_for_Meetup_Rides/

Here at MVD MTB'ers meetup page, we always appreciate any feedback, write a group review!( Here )
results.name: Newbie Ride @ Fairland

six:eight is part of the United Church of Christ, which is a mainline denomination that puts a strong emphasis on social justice. Our name, six:eight, comes from the Bible verse Micah 6:8 which says, "Act justly, love extravagantly, and walk humbly with your God."

results.description:
Join us for an afternoon of live Middle Eastern music, dance, and tasty treats at the New Deal Cafe in Greenbelt, Maryland. Laying down the tunes will be Kylie Hilali, Abderrahim Amthqal, Ken Wright, Heather Spence, Druminic, Jennifer Laemmer and Mark Cheater, plus guest musicians and singers, playing extraordinarily exotic instruments such as qanun, oud, ney and darbuka.

Our May 15 show will feature the Transcendence Bellydance Collective, Amira of Annapolis, Khuzama Lavender, and headliner Habiba. The second half of the show is all open dancing, so get up and shake your tailfeathers! Contact Latifa -- latifa (at) bintbeled (dot) com -- if you are interested in performing at a future show.

Suggested donation $10. Your contributions to the tip jar will help our local, dancer-friendly musicians feel appreciated and will pay our headliner. If you don't have cash, Latifa can swipe your credit card. Also, please order something delicious from the cafe and tip your waitstaff generously to ensure our ongoing welcome at this wonderful venue.

The New Deal Cafe offers luscious Lebanese food and desserts, captivating live entertainment, and an intimate community atmosphere. Exhibitions by local artists, and a decent cup of coffee.

Please note that since these shows regularly sell out and seats are hard to come by, your Meet Up RSVP does not guarantee you a table, Call the restaurant directly to make your reservation.

New Deal Cafe
113 Centerway
Roosevelt Center
Greenbelt, MD 20770
(301)[masked]

results.description:
(For pre-crawling babies, 6-weeks and older, and their caregivers)
I teach a flexible, playful "Baby & Me" yoga class at the Yoga Center of Columbia on Mondays at 11:15 am.

Caregivers can explore how song, infant massage, and gentle stretching can help babies improve coordination, sleep better, and fuss less. Forge a strong parent/child bond in a nurturing community. Focused and specialized attention given to postpartum needs, with emphasis on building strength while recovering from pregnancy and delivery. Guided relaxation, gentle stretching, and meditation provide a peaceful 'pause' during this busy time.

NEW PRICING! It's $18 to drop in for one class, or you can sign up for less than the full session by paying $16 x the number of classes.

For more information, call the studio at 410.720.4340. No prior yoga experience is necessary. Just wear comfortable clothing and bring a receiving blanket for baby.

results.description:
Monday at 2:00 p.m. will be 62 degrees &  sunny with 13 mph wind & 0% chance of rain.  Great day for a doggy walk :)  Let's enjoy the sunshine!


 Wilde Lake is a little gem of Columbia, 1.49 miles long, often we walk it twice to make it longer.Directions: Coming from south of the mall.....Travel North on Little Patuxent Pkwy past the Columbia Mall. Turn left at the intersection of W Running Brook Rd. Upon entering the housing development, take the left onto Hyla Brook Rd, there is a white sign there that reads "Birches". Continue on this road until you see a small parking lot near the water next to a stone building with a maroon roof.  It is across from the address 10022 Hyla Brook Road.We will meet there in the parking lot.


Let's turn left at the lake to start the walk (clockwise), so if you arrive late, either go left to catch up with us, or if you're really late, go right so you will run into us.  WE WILL LEAVE ON TIME, so please plan to arrive early.  Please change your RSVP if you won't be attending.  Otherwise if we leave and you aren't there, we'll keep an eye out for you.

**PLEASE bring WATER for yourself and your dogs.  It is better to have your dog's individual supply of water to protect against communicable disease.**

Columbia Dogs on the Go provides a way for friendly people with friendly dogs to meet people with similar interests on a voluntary basis. By replying "Yes" to this RSVP and attending this event, you acknowledge that:


•  You are responsible for your own safety and the safety of your dogs and any guests. 

•  Your dogs are current on their vaccinations.

•  Your dogs will be kept on a leash (non-retractable) and under your control at the Meetup.

•  You will clean up after your dogs at the Meetup.

•  You will update your RSVP if your plans change.

•  You understand that the Meetup ends when the walk ends. (If you choose to meet other members at a restaurant, dog park, or other location, it is on your own time and not part of the Meetup event.)

We look forward to seeing you there!


                                                                       Photos by J. Ameen-Lee
results.how_to_find_us: Park across the street from 10022 HYLA BROOK ROAD in the parking lot next to the stone building with maroon roof.
results.name: Enjoy the sunshine at 2:00 p.m. Monday Walk at Wilde Lake!

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
